description: common meta info, not specific to any code

metaInfos.description: Information that *in theory* should have no influence on the results
metaInfos.name: accessory_info

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_free.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_free

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_total_T0.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_T0

metaInfos.description: Some forces on the atoms (i.e. minus derivatives of some energy with respect to the atom position).
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_type

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_total.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces

metaInfos.description: Labels of the atoms. These strings identify the atom kind and conventionally start with atom name plus possible a number, X can be used for particles that do not correspond to atoms. (this defines a configuration and is required).
metaInfos.name: atom_label

metaInfos.description: Positions of the atoms (this defines a configuration and is required).
metaInfos.name: atom_position

metaInfos.description: string describing the method used to obtain the multipoles as described in the [atomic\_multipole\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/atomic-multipole-kind)
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_kind

metaInfos.description: l and m value of the multipoles
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_lm

metaInfos.description: value of the dipole (or monopole/charge for l = 0) of each atom calculated of atomic_multipole_kind
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_value

metaInfos.description: k band energies
metaInfos.name: band_energies

metaInfos.description: Coordinates of the k points actually building the band
metaInfos.name: band_k_points

metaInfos.description: Occupation of the k-point along the band
metaInfos.name: band_occupation

metaInfos.description: Start and end labels of the points sampled in the k-space
metaInfos.name: band_segm_labels

metaInfos.description: Coordinates of the start and end point of the segments sampled in the k-space
metaInfos.name: band_segm_start_end

metaInfos.description: Azimuthal quantum number ($l$) value (of the angular part given by the spherical harmonic $Y_{lm}$) of the basis function
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_ls

metaInfos.description: Radial function of the different basis function kinds, the 5 values are $r$, $f(r)$, $f'(r)$, $f(r)*r$, $\frac{d}{dr}(f(r)*r)$ and are given by default on an equispaced grid from 0 to 4 $nm$
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_radial_functions

metaInfos.description: Code dependent but explicative base name of the basis function, not unique. For example fhi-aims looks at the closest standard basis set, and uses that name. Details are explained in the [basis\_set\_atom\_centered\_short\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-atom-centered-short-name), this name should not contain the atom kind (to simplify the use of a single name for multiple elements).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_short_name

metaInfos.description: Code dependent explicative and unique name of the basis function, it uses basis_set_atom_centered_short_name and if not equal to the default basis set implied by that name appends the first 10 characters of the base64 url encoding of the SHA-512 of the diffs stored as normalized json, details are explained in the [basis\_set\_atom\_centered\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-atom-centered-unique-name), this name should not contain the atom kind (to simplify the use of a single name for multiple elements).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_unique_name

metaInfos.description: atomic number (number of protons) of the atom this basis set is thought for (0 means unspecified, or a pseudo atom)
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_number

metaInfos.description: A cell_associated basis set type, string should be as defined in the [basis\_set\_cell\_associated\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-cell-associated-kind).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_cell_associated_kind

metaInfos.description: A descriptive name identifying the basis set be as defined in the [basis\_set\_cell\_associated\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-cell-associated-name).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_cell_associated_name

metaInfos.description: Description of the building blocs of a basis set
metaInfos.name: basis_set_description

metaInfos.description: String describing the kind of basis set (its use, for example wavefunction). The values are described in the [basis\_set\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-kind).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_kind

metaInfos.description: String identifying the basis set in an unique way. The values are described in the [basis\_set\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-name).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_name

metaInfos.description: Spherical cutoff for a plane wave basis set in reciprocal space, as energy of the highest plane wave ($\frac{\hbar^2|k+G|^2}{2m_e}$, constants to check!) kept into the basis. Note that normally the basis set is used for the wavefunctions, and the density would have 4 times the cutoff, but this actually depends on the use of the basis set by the method.
metaInfos.name: basis_set_plan_wave_cutoff

metaInfos.description: String identifying in an unique way the basis set used for the final wavefunctions calculated with XC_method. It should refer (and be the same) to some basis_set_name which is described in the [basis\_set\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-name).
metaInfos.name: basis_set

metaInfos.description: String that represents the method used to calculate the energy_current. If the method is perturbative, this string does not describe the starting_point_method_ref. For normal ab-initio calculation, for example, this is composed of XC_method and basis_set and a unique sha,  see [calculation\_method\_current wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/calculation-method-current) for the details
metaInfos.name: calculation_method_current

metaInfos.description: kind of method in calculation_method_current: absolute or perturbative
metaInfos.name: calculation_method_kind

metaInfos.description: String that uniquely represents the method used to calculate energy_total, this consists of calculation_method_current plus '@' and calculation_method of the starting_point_method_ref for perturbative methods.
metaInfos.name: calculation_method

metaInfos.description: Properties actually defining the current configuration
metaInfos.name: configuration_core

metaInfos.description:
Which of the lattice vectors use periodic boundary conditions.
    A value is valid from the definition point for all subsequent values until redefined
    (i.e. if not changing it can be defined just once at the beginning).
metaInfos.name: configuration_periodic_dimensions

metaInfos.description: A quantity that is preserved during the time propagation (for example, kinetic+potential energy during NVE)
metaInfos.name: conserved_quantity

metaInfos.description: Values of the eigenvalues
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: A short string describing the kind of eigenvalues, as defined in the [eigenvalues\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/eigenvalues-kind).
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_kind

metaInfos.description: kpoints on which the eigenvalues were evaluated
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_kpoints

metaInfos.description: Occupation of that eigenfunction
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_occupation

metaInfos.description: Electronic kinetic energy as defined in XC_method during the scf iterations
metaInfos.name: electronic_kinetic_energy_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Electronic kinetic energy as defined in XC_method
metaInfos.name: electronic_kinetic_energy

metaInfos.description: Component of the correlation (C) energy at the (Meta)GGA level using the self-consistent density of the target functional (no exact exchange mixin, full unscaled value)
metaInfos.name: energy_C_mGGA

metaInfos.description: Correlation (C) energy using XC_functional
metaInfos.name: energy_C

metaInfos.description: At each scf iteration, change of total energy with respect to the previous scf iteration
metaInfos.name: energy_change_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Type of the shifted total energy that should be more comparable among different codes, numerical settings, ... Details can be found on the [energy\_comparable wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/energy-comparable).
metaInfos.name: energy_comparable_kind

metaInfos.description: Value of the shifted total energy that should be more comparable among different codes, numerical settings, ... Details can be found on the [energy\_comparable wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/energy-comparable).
metaInfos.name: energy_comparable_value

metaInfos.description: A value of an energy component per atom
metaInfos.name: energy_component_per_atom

metaInfos.description: A value of an energy component, expected to be an extensive property.
metaInfos.name: energy_component

metaInfos.description: Entropy correction, to have a potential energy that compensates the changes in occupation, so that forces at finite T do not need to keep the change of occupation in account. Values during the scf iteration. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_entropy_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Entropy correction, to have a potential energy that compensates the changes in occupation, so that forces at finite T do not need to keep the change of occupation in account. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_entropy

metaInfos.description: Correction to the density-density electrostatic energy in the sum of eigenvalues (that uses the mixed density on one side), and the fully consistend density-density electrostatic energy during the scf iterations. Defined consistently with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_hartree_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Correction to the density-density electrostatic energy in the sum of eigenvalues (that uses the mixed density on one side), and the fully consistend density-density electrostatic energy. Defined consistently with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_hartree

metaInfos.description: energy calculated with calculation_method_current. energy_current is equal to energy_total for non perturbation methods, and to the correction (energy_total - starting_point_calculation_ref.energy_total) for preturbation methods. [energy\_current wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/energy-current)
metaInfos.name: energy_current

metaInfos.description: Total electrostatic energy (atom + electrons) during the scf itrations
metaInfos.name: energy_electrostatic_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total electrostatic energy (atom + electrons), defined consistently with calculation_method
metaInfos.name: energy_electrostatic

metaInfos.description: Free energy (whose minimum gives a density with smeared occupation) calculated with XC_method per atom during the scf iterations
metaInfos.name: energy_free_per_atom_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Free energy (whose minimum gives a density with smeared occupation) calculated with XC_method per atom
metaInfos.name: energy_free_per_atom

metaInfos.description: Free energy (electronic + ions) (whose minimum gives the smeared occupation density) calculated with the method described in XC_method during the scf iterations
metaInfos.name: energy_free_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Free energy (electronic + ions) (whose minimum gives the smeared occupation density calculated with smearing_kind) calculated with the method described in XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_free

metaInfos.description: Error in the hartree (electrostatic) potential energy during the scf iterations. Defined consistently with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_error_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Error in the hartree (electrostatic) potential. Defined consistently with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_error

metaInfos.description: Scaled (depending on the mix paramenter of the functional) exact exchange energy. Defined consistently with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_fock_X_scaled

metaInfos.description: Converged exact exchange energy (not scaled). Defined consistently with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_fock_X

metaInfos.description: Energy of the method calculation_method_current. Depending on calculation_method_kind it might be a total energy or only a correction
metaInfos.name: energy_method_current

metaInfos.description: Sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method per atom during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues_per_atom_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method per atom
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues_per_atom

metaInfos.description: Sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: Total energy using XC_method per atom extapolated for T=0
metaInfos.name: energy_T0_per_atom

metaInfos.description: A value of a total potential energy per atom. Different total energies might have different 0, and so might not be directly comparable.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_potential_per_atom

metaInfos.description: A value of a total potential energy. Different total energies might have different 0, and so might not be directly comparable.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_potential

metaInfos.description: Total electronic energy calculated with XC_method during the scf iterations
metaInfos.name: energy_total_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total energy using XC_method per atom extapolated for T=0 during the scf iterations
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0_per_atom_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total energy using XC_method per atom extapolated for T=0
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0_per_atom

metaInfos.description: Total energy (or equivalently free energy) calculated with XC_method extrapolated for T=0 during the scf iterations
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total energy (or equivalently free energy), electronic + ions, calculated with the method described in XC_method and extrapolated for T=0 (for metals)
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0

metaInfos.description: Total energy (electronic + ions) calculated with the method described in calculation_method
metaInfos.name: energy_total

metaInfos.description: Some correlation (C) energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_C

metaInfos.description: Some kind of converged van der Waals energy
metaInfos.name: energy_type_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Some exchange-correlation (XC) energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_XC

metaInfos.description: Some exchange (X) energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_X

metaInfos.description: Some energy value
metaInfos.name: energy_value

metaInfos.description: Method used to compute van der Waals energy stored in energy_van_der_Waals_value. This is used when more than one van der Waals methods are applied in the same single configuration calculation. The main van der Waals method (the one concurring to energy_current and used, e.g., for evaluating the forces for a relaxation or dynamics is given in energy_van_der_Waals and defined in settings_van_der_Waals
metaInfos.name: energy_van_der_Waals_kind

metaInfos.description: Value of van der Waals energy, calculated with the method defined in energy_van_der_Waals_kind. This is used when more than one van der Waals methods are applied in the same single configuration calculation. The main van der Waals method (the one concurring to energy_current and used, e.g., for evaluating the forces for a relaxation or dynamics is given in energy_van_der_Waals and defined in settings_van_der_Waals
metaInfos.name: energy_van_der_Waals_value

metaInfos.description: Converged van der Waals energy calculated using the method described in van_der_Waals_method, and used in energy_current. This is the main van der Waals method (consistent with, e.g., forces used for relaxation or dynamics). Alternative methods are listed in section_energy_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: energy_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Component of the exchange (X) energy at the (Meta)GGA level using the self consistent density of the target functional, scaled accordingly to the mixing parameter
metaInfos.name: energy_X_mGGA_scaled

metaInfos.description: Component of the exchange (X) energy at the (Meta)GGA level using the self consistent density of the target functional (no exact exchange mixing, full unscaled value)
metaInfos.name: energy_X_mGGA

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) energy calculated with XC_functional
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_functional

metaInfos.description: Exchange Correlation (XC) potential energy: the integral of the first order functional derivative of the XC_functional, integral v_xc*electron_density, i.e. the component of xc that is in the sum of the eigenvalues. Typically DFT only. Value during the SCF cycle (not converged)
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_potential_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Exchange Correlation (XC) potential energy: the integral of the first order functional derivative of XC_functional, integral v_xc*electron_density, i.e. the component of XC that is in the sum of the eigenvalues. Typically DFT only. Value associated with the configuration, should be the most converged value.
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_potential

metaInfos.description: XC energy (integral of e_xc in the DFT case) during the scf iterations using XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Final exchange correlation (XC) energy calculated with XC_method
metaInfos.name: energy_XC

metaInfos.description: Exchange (X) energy using XC_functional
metaInfos.name: energy_X

metaInfos.description: Some estimate of a quantity contributing to the error of some values
metaInfos.name: error_estimate_partial

metaInfos.description: Some estimate of the error on the converged (final) value
metaInfos.name: error_estimate

metaInfos.description: Determines whether a geometry optimization is converged.
metaInfos.name: geometry_optimization_converged

metaInfos.description: Assignent, for each section_basis_set, of a basis set (as given in section_basis_set_atom_centered) to an atom.
metaInfos.name: mapping_section_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Assignement, for each section_basis_set, of the cell associated (i.e., non atom centered) parts of the basis set (as given in section_basis_set_cell_associated)
metaInfos.name: mapping_section_basis_set_cell_associated

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the computational program, associated with a single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: message_debug_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the computational program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: message_debug_run

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the computational program
metaInfos.name: message_debug

metaInfos.description: An error message of the computational program, associated with a single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: message_error_evaluation

metaInfos.description: An error message of the computational program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: message_error_run

metaInfos.description: An error message of the computational program
metaInfos.name: message_error

metaInfos.description: An information message of the computational program, associated with a a single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: message_info_evaluation

metaInfos.description: An information message of the computational program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: message_info_run

metaInfos.description: An information message of the computational program
metaInfos.name: message_info

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the computational program
metaInfos.name: message_warning_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the computational program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: message_warning_run

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the computational program
metaInfos.name: message_warning

metaInfos.description: Atomic number (number of protons) of this atom kind, use 0 if not an atom.
metaInfos.name: method_atom_kind_atom_number

metaInfos.description: String used to identify the atoms of this kind. This should correspond to the atom_label of the configuration. It is possible for one atom kind to have multiple labels.
metaInfos.name: method_atom_kind_label

metaInfos.description: Reference to the atom centered wavefunctions basis functions that should be used for the atoms of this kind.
metaInfos.name: method_atom_kind_wavefunctions_basis_set_ref

metaInfos.description: number of k points in each segment
metaInfos.name: n_k_points_per_segment

metaInfos.description: string describing the method used to obtain the multipoles
metaInfos.name: number_of_atomic_multipoles

metaInfos.description: Total number of atoms
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms

metaInfos.description: Number of different basis functions in this set. This is equal to the number of actual coefficents that are specified when using this basis set.
metaInfos.name: number_of_basis_functions_in_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Total number of basis functions (some might need complex coefficients).
metaInfos.name: number_of_basis_functions

metaInfos.description: number of kpoints
metaInfos.name: number_of_eigenvalues_kpoints

metaInfos.description: Number of eigenvalues
metaInfos.name: number_of_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: number of k point segments
metaInfos.name: number_of_k_point_segments

metaInfos.description: Number of different kinds of radial basis functions in this set. In practice, all the basis functions with the same $n$ and $l$ quantum number, here are counted only once
metaInfos.name: number_of_kinds_in_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Information on the parallelization of the program
metaInfos.name: parallelization_info

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the parsing program, associated with a single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_debug_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the parsing program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_debug_run

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the parsing program
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_debug

metaInfos.description: An error message of the parsing program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_error_run

metaInfos.description: An error message of the parsing program, associated with a single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_error_single_configuration

metaInfos.description: An error message of the parsing program
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_error

metaInfos.description: An information message of the parsing program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_info_run

metaInfos.description: An information message of the parsing program, associated with a a single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_info_single_configuration

metaInfos.description: An information message of the parsing program
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_info

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the parsing program
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_warning_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the parsing program, associated with a run
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_warning_run

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the parsing program
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_warning

metaInfos.description: Post Hartree-Fock method in standarized form. This is not fully unique. Some of the methods are: full-CI; CCS,CCS(D), CCSD, CCSD(T), CCSDT(Q)...; MP2, MP3, MP4,...; GW; MCSCF,CASSCF,CASPT2,MRCISD. The list should be extended or improved in particular with respect to the multi reference or local methods. If the value is absent or '' then no post hartree_fock method has been used.
metaInfos.name: post_hartree_fock_method

metaInfos.description: Program compilation date and time as seconds from unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds. Default to GMT timezone for date and times without timezone.
metaInfos.name: program_compilation_datetime

metaInfos.description: Host on which the program was compiled
metaInfos.name: program_compilation_host

metaInfos.description: Information on the program that generated the data
metaInfos.name: program_info

metaInfos.description: Name of the program that generated the data
metaInfos.name: program_name

metaInfos.description: Version of the program that was used. Should contain either the official version name or the referenze hashtag of a git repository as well as the location of the repository.
metaInfos.name: program_version

metaInfos.description: Short string describing the relativity treatment used for the calculation of the final energy and related quantities. No special treatment if skipped or empty. Relativity treatment strings are described on the [relativity\_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/relativity-method).
metaInfos.name: relativity_method

metaInfos.description: If this run was terminated properly. If false the run might have been killed or ended with an error
metaInfos.name: run_clean_end

metaInfos.description: Hosts that did run this simulation, this is a mapping, host->json value that might give extra program dependent information on how that host is used
metaInfos.name: run_hosts

metaInfos.description: number of scf iterations at Dft level
metaInfos.name: scf_dft_number_of_iterations

metaInfos.description: Information on the scf procedure
metaInfos.name: scf_info

metaInfos.description: multipoles (charges, dipole,...) for each atom
metaInfos.name: section_atomic_multipoles

metaInfos.description: Description of one or a sub group of basis functions in this basis set
metaInfos.name: section_basis_functions_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Each section_basis_set_atom_centered contains the definition of a specific atom centered basis set for a specific atom
metaInfos.name: section_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: A cell associated (atom independent) basis set, e.g., planewaves
metaInfos.name: section_basis_set_cell_associated

metaInfos.description: Contains reference to all basis sets used for a single configuration calculation. More than one basis set instance per single configuration calculation is needed, for example, for codes that implement adaptive basis sets along the scf convergence (see, .e.g., exciting). In such cases there is a section_basis_set instance per scf iteration, if necessary. Another example is having a basis set for wavefunctions, a differet one for the density, an auxiliary basis set for RI, ...
metaInfos.name: section_basis_set

metaInfos.description: groups eigenvalues of different spins
metaInfos.name: section_eigenvalues_group

metaInfos.description: eigenvalues of some energy for one spin channel
metaInfos.name: section_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: A shifted total energy that should be more comparable among different codes, numerical settings, ... Details can be found on the [energy-comparable wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/energy-comparable).
metaInfos.name: section_energy_comparable

metaInfos.description: Section containing a van der Waals energy value energy_van_der_Waals_value, of type van_der_Waals_kind. This is used when more than one van der Waals methods are applied in the same single configuration calculation. The main van der Waals method (the one concurring to energy_current and used, e.g., for evaluating the forces for a relaxation or dynamics is given in energy_van_der_Waals and defined in settings_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: section_energy_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Section collecting the information on a k band evaluation
metaInfos.name: section_k_band

metaInfos.description: Every section_method_atom_kind contains method related information about a kind of atom, and is identified by one or more string method_atom_kind_label. This categorisation into atom kinds is more flexible than just atomic species, because to different atoms of the same species different atom centered basis sets or pseudopotentials may be assigned. So, if for instance two different oxygen atoms are assigned two different basis sets or pseudopotentials, we have two distinguish them into two different *kinds* of O atoms, by creating two distinct section_method_atom_kind.
metaInfos.name: section_method_atom_kind

metaInfos.description: section_method contains the various parameters that define the theory used and the approximations done (convergence, thresholds,...) to perform a single configuration calculation. It does *not* contain the settings for dynamics, goemetry optimization,...
metaInfos.name: section_method

metaInfos.description: Every section_run represents a single call of a program. What exactly is contained in a run depends on the run type and the program.
metaInfos.name: section_run

metaInfos.description: Every section_scf_iteration section represents an scf iteration
metaInfos.name: section_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Every section_single_configuration_calculation contains the values computed during a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: section_single_configuration_calculation

metaInfos.description: Section to keep alternative values to stress_tensor that have been calculated
metaInfos.name: section_stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Every section_system_description contains the properties required to describe the physical system simulated, i.e., the given atomic configuration, the definition of periodic cell (if present), external potentials,...
metaInfos.name: section_system_description

metaInfos.description: Short string for the self interaction correction (SIC) treatment used to calculate the final energy and related quantities. No special treatment if skipped or empty. Other SIC treatment strings as described on the [self\_interaction\_correction\_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/self-interaction-correction-method).
metaInfos.name: self_interaction_correction_method

metaInfos.description: Coupled Clusters method parameters
metaInfos.name: settings_coupled_cluster

metaInfos.description: GW method parameters
metaInfos.name: settings_GW

metaInfos.description: Multi-configurational self-consistent field method parameters
metaInfos.name: settings_MCSCF

metaInfos.description: MllerPlesset perturbation theory parameters
metaInfos.name: settings_moller_plesset_perturbation_theory

metaInfos.description: Multireference single and double configuration interaction method parameters
metaInfos.name: settings_multi_reference

metaInfos.description: Post hartree fock method parameters
metaInfos.name: settings_post_hartree_fock

metaInfos.description: Parameters and information connected with the relativity treatment used in the calculation
metaInfos.name: settings_relativity

metaInfos.description: Parameters that control the whole run (but not the single configuration calculation)
metaInfos.name: settings_run

metaInfos.description: Parameters and information connected with self interaction correction (SIC) method used
metaInfos.name: settings_self_interaction_correction

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the smearing of the orbital occupation (finite electronic temperature)
metaInfos.name: settings_smearing

metaInfos.description: Setting to calculate stress_tensor, consistent with energy_total.
metaInfos.name: settings_stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Parameters and information connected with the van der Waals treatment used in the calculation to compute energy_van_der_Waals
metaInfos.name: settings_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Parameters connected with defining the exchange correlation (XC) functional
metaInfos.name: settings_XC_functional

metaInfos.description: Parameters connected with defining the exchange correlation (XC) treatment
metaInfos.name: settings_XC

metaInfos.description: Simulation cell (lattice vectors). The first index is x,y,z and the second index the lattice vector.
metaInfos.name: simulation_cell

metaInfos.description: Determines whether a single configuration calculation is converged.
metaInfos.name: single_configuration_calculation_converged

metaInfos.description: Reference to the method used for the calculation
metaInfos.name: single_configuration_calculation_method_ref

metaInfos.description: Reference to the system (atomic configuration, cell, ...) that is calculated
metaInfos.name: single_configuration_calculation_system_description_ref

metaInfos.description: The kind of smearing on the electron occupation used to calculate energy_free, valid values are given in the [smearing\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/smearing-kind)
metaInfos.name: smearing_kind

metaInfos.description: The width of the smearing in energy for the electon occupation used to calculate energy_free (if the method specified in smearing_kind uses it)
metaInfos.name: smearing_width

metaInfos.description: References to the source of the data (uri,...)
metaInfos.name: source_references

metaInfos.description: International Union of Crystallography number of the 3D space group
metaInfos.name: spacegroup_3D_number

metaInfos.description: Value of the total spin moment operator $S^2$ during the scf iterations of XC_method. Can be used to calculate the spin contamination in spin unrestricted calculations.
metaInfos.name: spin_S2_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Value of the total spin moment operator $S^2$ for the converged wavefunctions calculated with the XC_method, which can be used to calculate the spin contamination in spin unrestricted calculations.
metaInfos.name: spin_S2

metaInfos.description: Reference to the starting point (unperturbed) calculation, onto which the perturbative methods are constructed.
metaInfos.name: starting_point_calculation_ref

metaInfos.description: Reference to the method of the starting point (unperturbed) calculation, onto which the perturbative methods are constructed.
metaInfos.name: starting_point_method_ref

metaInfos.description: Method used to compute the stress tensor stored in stress_tensor_value. This is an *alternative* to the stress tensor defined in stress_tensor_method. The value of the latter is stored in stress_tensor and (if needed) it is the one used for dynamics, minimization,...
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_kind

metaInfos.description: Method used to calculate stress_tensor, the value of which is used (if needed) for dynamics, geometry minimization,...  The value should be with numeric or analytic.
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_method

metaInfos.description: A final value of a stress tensor
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_type

metaInfos.description: Stress tensor of kind stress_tensor_kind, which is an *alternative* to the one chosen in stress_tensor_method. The value of the latter is stored in stress_tensor and (if needed) it is the one used for dynamics, minimization,...
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_value

metaInfos.description: A final value of the default stress tensor of energy_total calculated with stress_tensor_method
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Target value of the multiplicity $M=2S+1$ where $S$ is the total spin. It is an integer number. This value is not necessarly reached.
metaInfos.name: target_multiplicity

metaInfos.description: Wall time needed for a calculation, using calculation_method_current
metaInfos.name: time_calculation

metaInfos.description: Information on date and timings
metaInfos.name: time_info

metaInfos.description: End time of the run on CPU 1
metaInfos.name: time_run_cpu1_end

metaInfos.description: Start time of the run on CPU 1
metaInfos.name: time_run_cpu1_start

metaInfos.description: End date of run stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds
metaInfos.name: time_run_date_end

metaInfos.description: Start date of the run stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds
metaInfos.name: time_run_date_start

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the end of the run
metaInfos.name: time_run_wall_end

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the start of the run
metaInfos.name: time_run_wall_start

metaInfos.description: End time of an scf iteration on CPU 1
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_cpu1_end

metaInfos.description: Start time of an scf iteration on CPU 1
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_cpu1_start

metaInfos.description: End date of scf stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_date_end

metaInfos.description: Start date of an scf iteration stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_date_start

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the end of an scf iteration
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_wall_end

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the start of an scf iteration
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_wall_start

metaInfos.description: End time of the single configuration calculation on CPU 1
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_cpu1_end

metaInfos.description: Start time of the single configuration calculation on CPU 1
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_cpu1_start

metaInfos.description: End date of the single configuration calculation stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds. Default to GMT timezone for date and times without timezone.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_date_end

metaInfos.description: Start date of the single configuration calculation stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds. Default to GMT timezone for date and times without timezone.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_date_start

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the end of the single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_wall_end

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the start of the single configuration calculation
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_wall_start

metaInfos.description: Total charge of the system.
metaInfos.name: total_charge

metaInfos.description: Short string describing the van der Waals method. No such method, if skipped or empty. Van der Waals treatement strings are described on the [van\_der\_Waals\_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/van-der-Waals-method).
metaInfos.name: van_der_Waals_method

metaInfos.description: Reference to the cell associated basis function to use for the wavefunctions.
metaInfos.name: wavefunctions_basis_set_cell_associated_ref

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) functional used for the final energy and related quantities in a unique short form as described in the [XC\_functional wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/public-wiki/wikis/metainfo/XC-functional).
metaInfos.name: XC_functional

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) method used for energy_XC consisting of XC_method_current plus '@' and the XC_method of the starting_point_method_ref for perturbative methods.
metaInfos.name: XC_method

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) method used for energy_XC and related quantities in standarized short form. Built joining the values in the following order: post_hartree_fock_method '_' XC_functional '_' self_interaction_correction_method '_' van_der_Waals_method '_' relativity_method. Finally a '_' and the first 10 characters of the base64 url encoding of SHA 512 checksum of a normalized json with all non redundant non derived settings_XC appended to make the string unique for every setting. With empty strings the connecting character is skipped. If done perturbatively this writes only the perturbation method, not the reference.
metaInfos.name: XC_method_current
